newsitem.title: FRANCE: AlliedSignal to buy aircraft lighting firm.
newsitem.headline: AlliedSignal to buy aircraft lighting firm.

text.p: U.S. aerospace and industrial group AlliedSignal Inc said at the Paris air show on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy aircraft lighting systems firm Grimes Aerospace from investment firm Forstmann Little.
Allied declined to give any details about price to be paid but said in a statement the deal would not affect its earnings in 1997 and would be earnings enhancing from 1998.
It also said Grimes Aerospace's current annual sales of $230 million, generated by 1,400 employees worldwide, were growing at a "double-digit" rate.

"Grimes' world-leading aircraft lighting systems are an important addition to our aerospace product offerings while the valves, heat exchangers and electronic systems will provide us with new product offerings in those industry segments, Allied's Aerospace president Daniel Burnham said in a statement.
"Grimes Aerospace's well-managed distribution channels and customer support systems are an excellent fit with our growing after-market parts and repair and overhaul business," he added.
